page.title: 14 Proj.5 Antony House
page.content:
{Antony House
Antony House was built by William Carew in 1721 on the site of an earlier house. It is well proportioned and elegant and a fine example of a house, built in the time of Queen Anne. It contains fine furniture and paintings some of which were painted by Sir Joshua Reynolds who was born in nearby Plympton.There is a painting of King Charles I, painted whilst he was on trial for his life and also of Sir John Carew who was one of his judges and who was hung, drawn and quartered when Charles II came back to the throne. The painting of Sir Alexander Carew , who changed sides during the cival war but ended up on the losing side and he was executed for treason was cut out of its frame because his_]
